column2: VERMONT DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: VT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Distractions that take your attention away from driving can be caused by ______ while driving.
column6: using your cell phone
column8: eating or drinking

column2: 2. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column6: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: Right lane closed
column8: No turns are allowed on this road

column2: 4. When a school bus is stopped with its red lights flashing:
column4: drivers don't need to stop unless they are in a school zone.
column6: drivers only need to stop if children are present.
column8: drivers may not pass while the red lights are flashing.

column2: 5. When passing a motorcycle, you must:
column4: have your vehicle entirely into the left lane before and during the pass.
column6: honk your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column8: speed up above the speed limit and use your emergency lights to alert the motorcyle that you are about to pass.

column2: 6. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 7. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column6: Railroad advance warning signs (round)
column8: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 8. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column6: stop much more quickly
column8: drive much faster

column2: 9. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column6: get back into the vehicle.
column8: signal the train to stop.

column2: 10. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column6: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.
column8: Pumping brakes.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column8: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.

column2: 12. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.
column6: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
column8: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.

column2: 13. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______Â of your vehicle.
column6: only on the left and right side
column8: on all sides

column2: 14. This sign means:
column6: Roundabout ahead. Slow down.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column10: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 15. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: stop doing what they are doing.
column10: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 16. A work zone:
column4: does not require that the driver slow down and pay extra attention.
column6: is marked with black and white signs.
column8: might involve vehicles and moving workers.

column2: 17. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column6: can handle
column8: must not yield to

column2: 18. Which shape is a stop sign?
column6: Diamond
column8: Octagon

column2: 19. If you see a horse and rider while driving, you should:
column4: accelerate to get by the horse.
column6: tell the rider to get out of the way.
column8: sound your horn to warn them.

column2: 20. When driving on roads that may be slippery:
column4: do not make any sudden changes in direction or speed.
column6: reduce your following distance.
column8: use cruise control to maintain a steady speed.
column10: always drive at the highest speed allowed.
